tool.name: xcms-find-peaks
tool.description: Find peaks in mzML file and generate a xcmsSet using XCMS centWave algorithm.
tool.command: ln -s ${xcms_find_peaks_input_1} ${xcms_find_peaks_input_1}.mzML; /usr/local/bin/findPeaks.r input=${xcms_find_peaks_input_1}.mzML output=$xcms_find_peaks_output_1 ppm=$ppm peakwidthLow=$peakwidthLow peakwidthHigh=$peakwidthHigh noise=$noise polarity=$polarity realFileName=$xcms_find_peaks_input_1.name #if $infilecvs: phenoFile=$infilecvs #end if #if $phenocol: phenoDataColumn=$phenocol #end if ;

param.name: xcms_find_peaks_input_1
param.label: mzML file
param.help: A mzML file that includes data from a MS measurement

param.name: ppm
param.label: PPM
param.help: Maxmial tolerated m/z deviation in consecutive scans, in ppm (parts per million)

param.name: peakwidthLow
param.label: PeakWidthLow
param.help: Minimum value of chromatographic peak width in seconds

param.name: peakwidthHigh
param.label: PeakWidthHigh
param.help: Maximum value of chromatographic peak width in seconds

param.name: noise
param.label: Noise
param.help: Argument which is useful for data that was centroided without any intensity threshold, centroids with intensity smaller noise are omitted from ROI detection

param.name: polarity
param.label: Polarity
param.help: Filter raw data for positive/negative scans

param.name: infilecvs
param.label: Input CSV file for setting the phenotype (see the help)

param.name: phenocol
param.label: Column name showing the class of the raw files (the phenotype file)

===================== XMCS Find Peaks =====================
----------- Description -----------
| This module handles the construction of XCMS-Set objects from mzML input files and finds peaks in batch mode.
----------- Input files -----------
+------------------------------+------------+ | File | Format | +==============================+============+ | 1) mzML file | mzML | +------------------------------+------------+ | 2) CSV file | CSV | +------------------------------+------------+
---------- Parameters ----------
mzML file | A mzML file that includes data from a MS measurement |
PPM | Maxmial tolerated m/z deviation in consecutive scans, in ppm (parts per million) |
PeakWidthLow | Minimum value of chromatographic peak width in seconds |
PeakWidthHigh | Maximum value of chromatographic peak width in seconds |
Noise | Argument which is useful for data that was centroided without any intensity threshold, centroids with intensity smaller noise are omitted from ROI detection |
Polarity | Filter raw data for positive/negative scans |
CSV file | This file is used to set class of the samples being analyzed. The file should have at least two column: the first column is showing the raw file name and extension (for example sample1.mzML) and the second column should show it's phenotype type. This file is a comma separated file and should container header (see the example). |
+----------------+----------+ | RawFile | Class | +----------------+----------+ | Sample1.mzML | Sample | +----------------+----------+ | Sample2.mzML | Sample | +----------------+----------+ | Sample3.mzML | Sample | +----------------+----------+ | Sample4.mzML | Sample | +----------------+----------+ | Blank1.mzML | Blank | +----------------+----------+ | Blank2.mzML | Blank | +----------------+----------+ | Blank3.mzML | Blank | +----------------+----------+ | D1.mzML | D1 | +----------------+----------+ | D2.mzML | D2 | +----------------+----------+ | D3.mzML | D3 | +----------------+----------+
Phenotype column | This should show the column name in the CSV file representing the class of the metabolite. In the case of the above table it should be set to "Class" (without quotation). |
------------ Output files ------------
xcms_find_peaks_output_1.rdata | A rdata file containing a XCMS-Set generated from the input mzML file |
